statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.headline: Miami (Ohio) 64, Akron 62, OT
article.story: OXFORD, Ohio (AP) -- Doug Penno hit a free throw in the final seconds and Michael Bramos scored five of Miami of Ohio's six overtime points to help the RedHawks hold on for a 64-62 win over Akron Wednesday night. Miami (14-12, 9-4 Mid-American) took a 32-22 lead into halftime and was ahead by 13 points with 15:28 left in the second half. But Akron (20-6, 10-3) outscored the RedHawks 32-19 to tie it at 58 with 15 seconds left in regulation. Romeo Travis scored 11 points during the run and Dru Joyce had 9, including two 3-pointers and the free throw that took the game into overtime. Tim Pollitz led the RedHawks with 17 points, Nathan Peavy had 14 and Penno came of the bench to score 12, going 3-of-4 on 3-pointers and free throws. Bramos had 11, including a 3-pointer and two free throws in overtime. Joyce, Travis and Jeremiah Wood each scored 15 for the Zips. Miami shot about 49 percent (23-of-47) for the game and Akron shot about 40 percent (21-of-53).
